Class TableHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Component

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Component>

    public class TableHeader
extends Container<com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.TableCell>
    A class representing the first row in a table.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableHeader

        public TableHeader(int x,
                   int y,
                   int height,
                   int[] cellWidths,
                   DrawableComponent[] components,
                   int hMargin,
                   int[] ids,
                   Table parent)
        Create a new table header with the given dimension and id.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        cellWidths - The width of each cell in this row.
        components - The components that make up the cells of this table row.
        hMargin - The margin the table containing this row added to the left and right of this row.
        ids - The ids that uniquely identify the cells within this row.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effect:
        The table header is initialized as a table row with the given parameters.
            super(x, y, height, 0, cellWidth, components, hMargin, ids)

      • TableHeader

                   int y,
                   int height,
                   int hMargin,

        Create a new table header with the given dimension and id.
        Parameters:

        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        hMargin - The margin the table containing this row added to the left and right of this row.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effect:
        The table header is initialized as a table row with the given parameters.
            super(x, y, height, 0, cellWidth, components, hMargin, ids)

        Parameters:

        contents - The contents of the new cells.
        ids - The ids of the cells in this row.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the arrays of cellWidths and components don't contain an equal number of entries.
